Description: Sherd from Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater. To left part of tongue pattern surrounding a handle; below part of a palmette below the handle. In the area between the handle roots a sketch of part of a human head, the upper lip drawn twice.
Producer name: Attributed to: The Painter of Munich 2335
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (121, pl. 66, 19)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1010)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
